results.title: Without love = Bez milosci [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zespoly Filmowe, Iluzjon Film Unit and Barbara Sass
results.brief_description: Pill-popping reporter Ewa Bracka (Dorota Stalinska), needs her uppers to fuel her all-consuming non-stop attempts at getting “the story”. Her determination to be a top journalist has no boundaries - cynical, ruthless, unethical, and unscrupulous, Ewa is prepared to sleep her way to the top. As Ewa herself says “The object of life is to live. To have it all and at any price”. Ewa is a single parent, living in Warsaw with her young daughter (the result of an affair whilst in Rome). With the help and support of her mother in caring for her daughter, Ewa is able to pursue her career, take up judo lessons and maintain the odd affair or two. Ewa believes in the issue, but has no time for the people, innocent or guilty, whom she may expose in getting her story on to the front page. That is until she meets and befriends Marianna, a young girl who lives and works in a local brothel. Through Marianna, Ewa is finally forced to confront her own demons. Cast includes Wladyslaw Kowalski, Malgorzata Zajaczkowska, Zdzislaw Wardejn, Emilian Kaminski, Jadwiga Polanowska, Malgorzata Pritulak. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Without consent
results.brief_description: Attempts to gain an understanding of sexually related violence in Australia. “Every woman’s fear. Part 1”: Examines the impact of a rape which occurred in Broadford Victoria in March 1991. The effects of sexual assault on victims, their families and the community are shown through poignant interviews with victims, police and counsellors. “The Dark Side. Part 2”: Provides an insight into the mind of the rapist with offenders describing their motivations, emotions and their view of the victim. Contains a powerful interview with a victim of male sexual assault.

results.title: Without anesthesia = Bez znieczulenia [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Film Polski, Barbara Pec-Slesicka and Andrzej Wajda
results.brief_description: A deeply moving film by the renowned Polish director, Andrzej Wajda (Man of marbles, Korczak, Danton) of one man’s life seemingly falling apart around him. Jerzy Michalowski (Zbigniew Zapasiewicz), a well-known Polish international journalist unwittingly upsets the Polish authorities with his knowledge and political commentary on world affairs, and Polish affairs, on national television. Upon returning from an assignment abroad, Jerzy suddenly finds his privileges have been cut back, his next course at the university cancelled and his next trip no longer necessary. At the same time as his career appears to be crumbling apart, Jerzy’s wife has also decided to leave him for a younger colleague. Fundamentally a sympathetic character, the film follows Jerzy on his downward spiral as his whole world collapses in front of him. A story which subliminally hits out at the Polish system, but primarily a story of human relationships containing an interesting blend of drama, tragedy and humour. In Polish with English subtitles. Cast also includes Ewa Datkowska, Andrzej Seweryn, Krystyna Janda, Roman Wilhelmi. (Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1979; Polish Film Festival 1978)

results.title: Without a sound
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Victorian College of the Arts, University of Melbourne and Michael Henry
results.brief_description: Thomas is an insurance investigator called out on the eve of his wife leaving, to attend a mysterious fire in which an unknown boy has been killed. Going through the motions while awaiting a call from his wife, Thomas - like the viewer, is drawn into the mysteries of the fire. (Awards: Best Cinematography, nominated Best Film, Best Sound, VCA, 1998)

results.title: Within these city walls
results.brief_description: Today in the old German cities we can still meet the Middle Ages. Through their buildings, pictures and documents we can trace the history of their growth, the expansion of trade and development of craftsmanship. The proud and beautiful buildings of medieval cities and towns are a memento of their struggle for liberty and municipal independence.

results.title: With Yau Kai in Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Gail Singer
results.brief_description: Takes a look at the life style of a 14 year old boy who lives in on a sampan in one of the harbours near Hong Kong. Highlights aspect of commerce and trade in the area and the intrusion of Western values in a traditional life style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Gail Singer

results.title: With time to kill
results.creator_credit: Chair Films, Australian Film Commission, AFTRS and James Clayden
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Melbourne this is a tale of justice and revenge when two cops decide that the court system has failed and it is now up to them to take the law into their own hands. Cast includes Ian Scott, Elizabeth Huntley, Jan Friedl, James Clayden, John Howard, Stephen Cummins, Barry Dickins, Joe Dolce, Nigel Buesst, Neil Gladwin. Music by Chris Knowles, Stephen Cummins, Ollie Olsen. Director of photography, Laurie McInnes.

results.title: With these hands
results.creator_credit: Promotional Films, International Ladies Garment Workers' Union and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: The story of the International Ladies Garment Workers’ Union. Signing his retirement blank, Alexander Brody looks back over the years to 1910 when the ILGWU was founded; he remembers the days of the pickets, the Great Revolt, the harrowing holocaust of the Triangle fire, the days of trouble in the 1920s and finally the emergence of union power. The film also illustrates the present work of the union. With Sam Levene, Arlene Francis and Joseph Wiseman.

results.title: With the best of intentions
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robin Hughes and Bill Steller
results.brief_description: This film looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Compares two professional Sydney families to show how broader social developments and conflicts are reflected in middle-class approaches to child rearing.

results.title: With Oscar in Peru
results.creator_credit: Journal Films, Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Kevan Barker
results.brief_description: A study of Oscar, thirteen, who lives at 13000 feet on the Peruvian altipiano. He is an active member of his community and is shown tending the village sheep, planting seedlings, spinning wool and harvesting the family’s potatoes. Shows the poverty and barren nature of the land and the lack of variety in the diet of the peasant farmer.
